results.title: Tracker
results.creator_credit: Kent Nason, Rex Tasker and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: A view from the cockpit of a VS880 Tracker aircraft patrolling Atlantic coastal waters and the eastern Arctic from its base in Shearwater, Nova Scotia. The film is a demonstration of the kind of peacetime missions served by the air arm of the Canadian Armed Forces in protecting territorial waters against illegal incursion and pollution, and in safe-guarding national sovereignty.

results.title: Track and field for intermediate grades (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Dave Turkington and Universal Education and Visual Arts
results.brief_description: Shows how track and field activities may be taught either in a gym or out-of-doors. Emphasises attentionto improving inexpensive indoor jumping pits, hurdles, and other indoor equipment.

results.title: Tracing the spread of infection
results.creator_credit: Michael Clarke, Jack Chambers, British Ministry of Health and Nucleus Film Unit
results.brief_description: Contains the only known film records of the phage typing test and the coagulose test. It demonstrates how these tests can be used to trace a strain of staphylococcus back to the source in a human carrier.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Clarke, Jack Chambers, British Ministry of Health and Nucleus Film Unit

results.title: Tra
results.brief_description: Tells the story of Tra and his family and their fight for survival in post-war Vietnam. Before moving to the city Tra’s family were rice farmers but now they live in overcrowded conditions where malnutrition and disease are increasing

results.title: Toys from Nuremberg
results.brief_description: Traces the history of the toy industry in Nuremberg. The first wooden toys were made 600 years ago, today automated precision machines produce 70% of the toys. The favourites of the 17th century were lead soldiers and doll’s houses, now it is electric trains and vacuum cleaners.

results.title: Toys
results.brief_description: It begins with the faces of children outside a toy store window at Christmas—but then the war toys appear and we realize that some games are played for keeps. This film has no commentary, but it is easy to see what it aims to show: war toys do not necessarily make warriors, but it is possible that they give a false glamor to the deadly pursuit. With toys that keep up with the times, this film creates a battle that is all too real and frightening.

results.title: Toyland = March of the wooden soldiers = Babes in toyland
results.creator_credit: Charles Rogers, Gus Meins and Auerbach Film Enterprises
results.brief_description: Stanley Dum and Oliver Dee are well-meaning but brainless toymakers in Toyland. They misinterpret an order from Santa Claus for 600 one foot high toy soldiers and make instead 100 six feet high soldiers. But their toy army comes in handy when the evil Barnaby and his furry Bogeymen invade Toyland. Starring Stan Laurel and Oliver Hardy along with Virginia Karns, Charlotte Henry, Felix Knight, Florence Roberts, Henry Kleinbach. A musical operetta.

results.title: Toying with their future
results.creator_credit: Claire Nadon, Margaret Pettigrew and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Toys are big business. This discussion takes a hard look at aspects of the toy industry and the impact that popular toys have on children. Toy manufacturers promote dolls such as GI Joe and Barbie; children’s author, Marie Louise Gay, and Vietnam veteran Dave Cline question their influence, and whether the implicit values are what we really want for our children.

results.title: Toy story [DVD]
results.creator_credit: John Lasseter, Bonnie Arnold, Ralph Guggenheim, Pixar Animation Studios and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: Awarded a special Academy Award for Special Achievement, this fully animated adventure is riotous fun for kids of all ages. When a draw-stringed cowboy named Woody, his boy’s favourite toy, is replaced one birthday by the latest toy - a flashy new space-ranger named Buzz Lightyear, it sparks an outrageous tiff between toys. Accidentally whisked away from home and into the clutches of the neighbourhood bully, these two squabbling rivals must work together as a team if they are to escape. Visual wizardry, uproarious laughs and the coolest characters ever assembled transform the world’s first computer-animated feature film into an incomparable movie marvel.
